{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk & Administrative Associate",
  "description": "Livestock Feeds Plc is a subsidiary of UACN, engaged in production of Animal Feeds and other related products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Front Desk &amp; Administrative Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	As Busha transitions into a physical office space, we&rsquo;re looking for a proactive and highly organized Front Desk &amp; Administrative Officer to manage our front office operations and provide comprehensive administrative and office support.
	This person will be the face of our organization, ensuring a warm welcome for all guests while supporting internal teams with office coordination, supplies, and events.
	You will work closely with the People Operations team to create a welcoming environment for clients and staff, while also coordinating office logistics, vendor relationships, and day-to-day operational tasks that support the team&rsquo;s productivity and well-being.


Responsibilities
Front Desk Management:


	Welcome and attend to guests, clients, and vendors professionally and warmly.
	Manage all incoming calls and inquiries and redirect them appropriately.
	Ensure the reception and communal areas are tidy, presentable, and well-stocked at all times.
	Manage incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Maintain a clean and well-organized front desk and reception area.


Administrative Support:


	Provide daily administrative support to the HR and Operations team.
	Maintain proper filing systems for documentation, invoices, and records.
	Assist with travel bookings, logistics, and scheduling internal/external meetings.
	Support scheduling and coordination of company-wide meetings and team activities.
	Support the People Operations team with administrative duties and ad hoc tasks.


Office Coordination:


	Monitor and ensure timely replenishment of office supplies and stationery.
	Coordinate with vendors for facility management and supply procurement.
	Maintain inventory of office equipment and supplies.
	Ensure office supplies are stocked and make purchase requests as needed.
	Coordinate with service providers (cleaning, internet, security, etc.) to maintain smooth office operations.
	Schedule and prepare meeting rooms for internal and external meetings
	Manage incoming and outgoing mails, including sorting, distributing, and preparing shipments.
	Prepare agendas and minutes for meetings.
	Coordinate office maintenance and repairs, liaising with vendors and ensuring timely completion.
	Assist in the management of office equipment and ensure proper functioning.
	Maintain and update internal databases and records.
	Handle photocopying, scanning, and binding of documents.
	Perform other administrative duties as assigned to ensure efficient office operations.


Event &amp; Meeting Support:


	Assist in organizing and coordinating in-office events, training sessions, and team bonding activities.
	Provide hands-on support before and during events to ensure smooth execution.
	Ensure meeting rooms are clean, well-prepared, and functioning with necessary tools.
	Experience working in a Fintech or startup environment
	Familiarity with basic HR or office management tools
	Event coordination or vendor management experience
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information


Requirements
The ideal employee must have:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration or a related field
	Minimun of 3 years of experience in a front desk or administrative role
	Experience working in a Fintech or startup environment.
	Familiarity with basic HR or office management tools
	Event coordination or vendor management experience
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Good organizational and multitasking abilities
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace
	Professional, friendly, and proactive attitude.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Livestock Feeds Plc"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "name": "",
    "value": "184776"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Front Desk & Administrative Associate Job at Livestock Feeds Plc




        
    

        
        Livestock Feeds Plc is a subsidiary of UACN, engaged in production of Animal Feeds and other related products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk & Administrative Associate

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	As Busha transitions into a physical office space, we’re looking for a proactive and highly organized Front Desk & Administrative Officer to manage our front office operations and provide comprehensive administrative and office support.
	This person will be the face of our organization, ensuring a warm welcome for all guests while supporting internal teams with office coordination, supplies, and events.
	You will work closely with the People Operations team to create a welcoming environment for clients and staff, while also coordinating office logistics, vendor relationships, and day-to-day operational tasks that support the team’s productivity and well-being.


Responsibilities
Front Desk Management:


	Welcome and attend to guests, clients, and vendors professionally and warmly.
	Manage all incoming calls and inquiries and redirect them appropriately.
	Ensure the reception and communal areas are tidy, presentable, and well-stocked at all times.
	Manage incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Maintain a clean and well-organized front desk and reception area.


Administrative Support:


	Provide daily administrative support to the HR and Operations team.
	Maintain proper filing systems for documentation, invoices, and records.
	Assist with travel bookings, logistics, and scheduling internal/external meetings.
	Support scheduling and coordination of company-wide meetings and team activities.
	Support the People Operations team with administrative duties and ad hoc tasks.


Office Coordination:


	Monitor and ensure timely replenishment of office supplies and stationery.
	Coordinate with vendors for facility management and supply procurement.
	Maintain inventory of office equipment and supplies.
	Ensure office supplies are stocked and make purchase requests as needed.
	Coordinate with service providers (cleaning, internet, security, etc.) to maintain smooth office operations.
	Schedule and prepare meeting rooms for internal and external meetings
	Manage incoming and outgoing mails, including sorting, distributing, and preparing shipments.
	Prepare agendas and minutes for meetings.
	Coordinate office maintenance and repairs, liaising with vendors and ensuring timely completion.
	Assist in the management of office equipment and ensure proper functioning.
	Maintain and update internal databases and records.
	Handle photocopying, scanning, and binding of documents.
	Perform other administrative duties as assigned to ensure efficient office operations.


Event & Meeting Support:


	Assist in organizing and coordinating in-office events, training sessions, and team bonding activities.
	Provide hands-on support before and during events to ensure smooth execution.
	Ensure meeting rooms are clean, well-prepared, and functioning with necessary tools.
	Experience working in a Fintech or startup environment
	Familiarity with basic HR or office management tools
	Event coordination or vendor management experience
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information


Requirements
The ideal employee must have:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or a related field
	Minimun of 3 years of experience in a front desk or administrative role
	Experience working in a Fintech or startup environment.
	Familiarity with basic HR or office management tools
	Event coordination or vendor management experience
	Ability to maintain discretion and handle confidential information
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Good organizational and multitasking abilities
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace
	Professional, friendly, and proactive attitude.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Supply Chain Manager",
  "description": "Ikeja Electric is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country&#39;s economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well-being of our employees and customers.

At Ikeja Electric, we don&rsquo;t just power homes and businesses &ndash; we power careers. As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	Responsible for ensuring continuous improvement, compliance, and operational efficiency in SCM processes through performance benchmarking, assurance activities, policy development, and the alignment of procurement standards with business goals.


Role Accountabilities


	Drive functional excellence by leading contract optimization reviews, bid administration, commercial assurance, cost estimation, and other assurance activities.
	Conduct Business Process Reviews (BPRs), internal health checks, and self-audits across SCM functions.
	Coordinate SCM performance dashboards and key metrics; perform gap analysis to improve operational outcomes.
	Review and update SCM policies and procedures in alignment with global best practices.
	Collaborate with user departments to define product standards and specifications for procurement and inventory.
	Facilitate inspection and testing of goods delivered to IE to ensure alignment with approved specifications and standards.
	Ensure installation work orders reflect approved specifications and monitor contractor compliance during project execution.
	Track and evaluate contractor proposals and global trends to recommend superior or cost-effective materials and practices.
	Liaise with departments to test new products and technologies, fostering innovation in supply chain operations.
	Perform other tasks as assigned by the HOD and MD/CEO.
	Comply with Quality Management System (QMS) and Occupational Health &amp; Safety (OH&amp;S) requirements.


Minimum Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Engineering, Quantity Surveying, Procurement or related field.
	10&ndash;12 years of experience in Supply Chain Management or similar field.
	Membership in a recognized professional body is an advantage.
	Strong numerical and analytical skills.
	Working knowledge of global supply chain standards and best practices.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Supply Chain Manager Job at Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company Plc




        
    

        
        Ikeja Electric is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country's economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well-being of our employees and customers.
     

            
    



At Ikeja Electric, we don’t just power homes and businesses – we power careers. As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Manager
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	Responsible for ensuring continuous improvement, compliance, and operational efficiency in SCM processes through performance benchmarking, assurance activities, policy development, and the alignment of procurement standards with business goals.


Role Accountabilities


	Drive functional excellence by leading contract optimization reviews, bid administration, commercial assurance, cost estimation, and other assurance activities.
	Conduct Business Process Reviews (BPRs), internal health checks, and self-audits across SCM functions.
	Coordinate SCM performance dashboards and key metrics; perform gap analysis to improve operational outcomes.
	Review and update SCM policies and procedures in alignment with global best practices.
	Collaborate with user departments to define product standards and specifications for procurement and inventory.
	Facilitate inspection and testing of goods delivered to IE to ensure alignment with approved specifications and standards.
	Ensure installation work orders reflect approved specifications and monitor contractor compliance during project execution.
	Track and evaluate contractor proposals and global trends to recommend superior or cost-effective materials and practices.
	Liaise with departments to test new products and technologies, fostering innovation in supply chain operations.
	Perform other tasks as assigned by the HOD and MD/CEO.
	Comply with Quality Management System (QMS) and Occupational Health & Safety (OH&S) requirements.


Minimum Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Quantity Surveying, Procurement or related field.
	10–12 years of experience in Supply Chain Management or similar field.
	Membership in a recognized professional body is an advantage.
	Strong numerical and analytical skills.
	Working knowledge of global supply chain standards and best practices.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Contract Admin Manager Job at PZ Cussons




        
    

        
        PZ Cussons is a dynamic consumer products group and innovator of some of the world's best known and loved brands. Calling on over 130 years of expertise, we operate internationally in carefully selected developed and emerging markets that present the greatest strategic potential for future growth. Our world-class supply chain and distribution networks enable us to meet our global consumer needs and deliver quality brands that add value and enhance everyday lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contract Admin Manager

Job Requisition ID: JR002251
Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Factory Admin Manager oversees all administrative activities to ensure smooth and efficient operations within a manufacturing facility.
	This role involves managing daily support operations, developing administrative procedures, coordinating with other departments, and managing human capital and compliance-related matters

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Executive",
  "description": "Fadac Resources and Services Limited -&nbsp;Our client is a group of companies in Nigeria. Due to expansion, they are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Partnering with hiring managers to understand manpower needs and develop recruitment strategies accordingly.
	Conducting interviews, background checks, and oversee onboarding processes.
	Ensuring strict compliance with Nigerian labor laws, maritime regulations, and company policies.
	Monitoring and evaluating performance improvement plans and probation reviews.
	Maintaining up-to-date HR records, employee files, and HRIS systems.
	Overseeing the preparation of employment letters, contracts, ID cards, and other HR documentation.
	Managing leave administration, attendance records, and ensure proper documentation.
	Working with managers to set KPIs and track employee performance metrics.
	Leading end-to-end recruitment processes for both technical and non-technical roles, including seafarers, port staff, drivers, logistics coordinators, etc.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in a logistics/shipping company
	Strong understanding of HR functions and employment regulations within the shipping &amp; logistics industry.
	Proficient in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Familiarity with maritime labour conventions and seafarer HR documentation is an added advantage.
	Knowledge of HSE procedures and workforce risk management in logistics operations.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;emmanuel.o@fadacresources.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-07-28",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "Fadac Resources and Services"
    
  },

}



Human Resources Executive Job at Fadac Resources and Services Limited




        
    

        
        Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our client is a group of companies in Nigeria. Due to expansion, they are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Executive

Job Location: Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Partnering with hiring managers to understand manpower needs and develop recruitment strategies accordingly.
	Conducting interviews, background checks, and oversee onboarding processes.
	Ensuring strict compliance with Nigerian labor laws, maritime regulations, and company policies.
	Monitoring and evaluating performance improvement plans and probation reviews.
	Maintaining up-to-date HR records, employee files, and HRIS systems.
	Overseeing the preparation of employment letters, contracts, ID cards, and other HR documentation.
	Managing leave administration, attendance records, and ensure proper documentation.
	Working with managers to set KPIs and track employee performance metrics.
	Leading end-to-end recruitment processes for both technical and non-technical roles, including seafarers, port staff, drivers, logistics coordinators, etc.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in a logistics/shipping company
	Strong understanding of HR functions and employment regulations within the shipping & logistics industry.
	Proficient in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Familiarity with maritime labour conventions and seafarer HR documentation is an added advantage.
	Knowledge of HSE procedures and workforce risk management in logistics operations.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: emmanuel.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive",
  "description": "Alan &amp; Grant -&nbsp;Our client is a leading infrastructure development company in Africa.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Developing innovative sales strategies to achieve sales goals.
	Identifying potential customers through networking initiatives, cold-calling, and email communications
	Implement Global Sales target by setting personal sales target with line manager to achieve set targets.
	Evaluate sales results and create sales report before Sales and Marketing Director
	Collect inquiries, complaints and customers and handle appropriately.
	Coordinate with the legal and finance department within the Group to ensure strict compliance to regulations (external and Internal)
	Conduct weekly and monthly reports to senior management on sales targets, enquiries and clients&rsquo; feedback.
	Supporting the commercial strategy team in working with PMIs to collaborate on home acquisition financing products for the company&#39;s customers.
	Ensure collections of sales proceeds in a timely and efficient manager
	Preparing and delivering sales presentations to potential and existing customers.
	Researching competitors&rsquo; products, pricing and product success and advising management on innovation measures to foster sales.
	Resolving customer complaints in a timely and professional manner to maintain customer loyalty.
	Support the mortgage team in credit profiling, and the development and application of a list of criteria that will allow the organization to adequately profile and pre- qualify customers for alternative financing products e.g. rent to own, housing solution fund, NHF etc.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree (or equivalent), preferably major in marketing or business administration focusing on marketing/sales.
	3 - 5 years of experience in real estate sales, especially in Domestic Market
	Certified Sales Professional (CSP) certification is an added advantage.
	Understand the real estate market and needs of domestic customers.
	Familiar with the country real estate brokerage market
	Understand the business/sales strategies of the company, and of real estate industries.
	Should possess strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate both in the regional language of the focus country as well as English.
	Access to PMIs relationships and ability to develop a strong and healthy pipeline of leads for real estate sales through the Primary Mortgage Institution market segment and customer base.
	Strong negotiation and consultative sales skills
",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Alan & Grant"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "184774"
  },
  "baseSalary": {

Sales Executive Job at Alan & Grant




        
    

        
        Alan & Grant - Our client is a leading infrastructure development company in Africa.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Developing innovative sales strategies to achieve sales goals.
	Identifying potential customers through networking initiatives, cold-calling, and email communications
	Implement Global Sales target by setting personal sales target with line manager to achieve set targets.
	Evaluate sales results and create sales report before Sales and Marketing Director
	Collect inquiries, complaints and customers and handle appropriately.
	Coordinate with the legal and finance department within the Group to ensure strict compliance to regulations (external and Internal)
	Conduct weekly and monthly reports to senior management on sales targets, enquiries and clients’ feedback.
	Supporting the commercial strategy team in working with PMIs to collaborate on home acquisition financing products for the company's customers.
	Ensure collections of sales proceeds in a timely and efficient manager
	Preparing and delivering sales presentations to potential and existing customers.
	Researching competitors’ products, pricing and product success and advising management on innovation measures to foster sales.
	Resolving customer complaints in a timely and professional manner to maintain customer loyalty.
	Support the mortgage team in credit profiling, and the development and application of a list of criteria that will allow the organization to adequately profile and pre- qualify customers for alternative financing products e.g. rent to own, housing solution fund, NHF etc.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent), preferably major in marketing or business administration focusing on marketing/sales.
	3 - 5 years of experience in real estate sales, especially in Domestic Market
	Certified Sales Professional (CSP) certification is an added advantage.
	Understand the real estate market and needs of domestic customers.
	Familiar with the country real estate brokerage market
	Understand the business/sales strategies of the company, and of real estate industries.
	Should possess strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate both in the regional language of the focus country as well as English.
	Access to PMIs relationships and ability to develop a strong and healthy pipeline of leads for real estate sales through the Primary Mortgage Institution market segment and customer base.
	Strong negotiation and consultative sales skills
    

    

        Click here to Apply
